intro: Hieracium apocladum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is typically found in grasslands and open areas. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in a composite head, which is typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Hieracium apocladum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
